title: Grouping satellite bands by spectral and spatial resolution
text: frequently download files satellite bands ESA USGS websites perform data analysis, transform store DBMS. downloaded files ZIP TAR format. cases, necessary download several files cover study area, first operation perform merge bands. access bands explicitly indicate name location files. goal satres (satellite spectral spatial resolution) facilitate operations least partially automating . includes function makes easier decompress files, useful downloading many files. treat together, enough indicate folder contains decompressed files: Satellite bands automatically obtained name (spectral) spatial resolution; several files cover geographical area, corresponding bands automatically merged. result can stored disk can also obtained objects class SpatRaster, package terra. following illustrative example package works, show usage features offers. title: Grouping satellite bands by spectral and spatial resolution

title: Grouping satellite bands by spectral and spatial resolution
text: want analysis based raster data obtained satellite area municipality Lanjarón Granada (Spain). cover area, downloaded two satellite band files ESA website. S2A_MSIL2A_20230905T105621_N0509_R094_T30SVF_20230905T170700.zip: 0.91 GB S2A_MSIL2A_20230905T105621_N0509_R094_T30SVG_20230905T170700.zip: 1.14 GB case, area small requires two files, can decompress one one unzip tool. can also use sat_untarzip() function package: decompresses indicated list files files included given folder. unzipped directly folder (esa folder), creating two subfolders. order reduce size can included package, additionally selected transformed original raster files, grouping using terra::aggregate() function factor 100. result following folders: esa/f: 751 KB esa/g: 842 KB folders included package. directly contain raster files transformed according previous description. can access shown .
code: sat_untarzip("download/esa", out_dir = "esa") f <- system.file("extdata", "esa/f", package = "satres") g <- system.file("extdata", "esa/g", package = "satres")

title: Grouping satellite bands by spectral and spatial resolution
text: merge satellite bands corresponding geographical area (tiles) classify according spatial resolution, create object satres class. pass parameter folder files located. can also indicate work folder parameter, virtual rasters created; none indicated, temporary folder used. default, satellite bands (B01 B12) considered. setting only_bands parameter FALSE, can indicate raster files included folders cover area interest also treated, shown code . case need bands (B01 B12), obtain data stored package.
code: sr_all <- satres(dir = "esa", out_dir = "esa/out", only_bands = FALSE) esa <- system.file("extdata", "esa", package = "satres") sr <- satres(dir = esa)

title: Grouping satellite bands by spectral and spatial resolution
text: Next consult spatial resolution result (remember changed resolution, adding factor 100). obtain object class SpatRaster terra package bands indicated spatial resolution. show available bands, represent graphically .  bands directly accessible name (B02, B03, B04 B08 figure), within object obtained result. way can obtain objects levels spatial resolution. case going show names bands. can save results disk using functions terra package. can also save directly using save_by_resolution() function, stores file names obtained based spatial resolution. example, only_show_files parameter controls execution function displays file names.
code: sr |>   get_spatial_resolution() #> [1] "r1000m" "r2000m" "r6000m" r1000m <- sr |>   as_SpatRaster("r1000m") terra::plot(r1000m) r2000m <- sr |>   as_SpatRaster("r2000m") names(r2000m) #>  [1] "B01" "B02" "B03" "B04" "B05" "B06" "B07" "B11" "B12" "B8A"  r6000m <- sr |>   as_SpatRaster("r6000m") names(r6000m) #>  [1] "B01" "B02" "B03" "B04" "B05" "B06" "B07" "B09" "B11" "B12" "B8A" sr |>   save_by_resolution(out_dir = "esa/out", only_show_files = TRUE) #> [1] "esa/out/r1000m.tif" "esa/out/r2000m.tif" "esa/out/r6000m.tif"

title: Grouping satellite bands by spectral and spatial resolution
text: functions satres package make easier work satellite rasters. Instead accessing files individually name, merges files form tiles area groups according spatial resolution one object. can obtain objects class SpatRaster work terra package can store result disk process means.

what: Grouping Satellite Bands by Spectral and Spatial Resolution
title: Grouping Satellite Bands by Spectral and Spatial Resolution
text: frequently download files satellite bands ESA USGS websites perform data analysis, transform store DBMS. downloaded files ZIP TAR format. cases, necessary download several files cover study area, first operation perform merge bands. access bands explicitly indicate name location files. goal satres (satellite spectral spatial resolution) partially automate operations. enough indicate folder contains decompressed files: Satellite bands automatically obtained name (spectral) spatial resolution; several files cover geographical area, corresponding bands automatically merged. result can stored disk can also obtained objects class SpatRaster, package terra. Currently supports files obtained following sources characteristics: Landsat 8-9 OLI/TIRS C2 L1 (Landsat 8-9 Operational Land Imager Thermal Infrared Sensor Collection 2 Level-1). Landsat 7 ETM+ C2 L1 (Landsat 7 Enhanced Thematic Mapper Plus Collection 2 Level-1). Landsat 4-5 TM C2 L1 (Landsat 4-5 Thematic Mapper Collection 2 Level-1). Sentinel-2 MSI S2MSI1C (Sentinel-2 Level-1C). Sentinel-2 MSI S2MSI2A (Sentinel-2 Level-2A).

title: Grouping Satellite Bands by Spectral and Spatial Resolution
text: can install released version satres CRAN : development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("satres") devtools::install_github("josesamos/satres")

title: Grouping Satellite Bands by Spectral and Spatial Resolution
text: cover area municipality Lanjarón Granada (Spain), downloaded two satellite band files ESA website. S2A_MSIL2A_20230905T105621_N0509_R094_T30SVF_20230905T170700.zip: 0.91 GB S2A_MSIL2A_20230905T105621_N0509_R094_T30SVG_20230905T170700.zip: 1.14 GB unzipped directly folder, creating two subfolders. Additionally, selected transformed original raster files, grouping using terra::aggregate() function factor 100, reduce size can included package. result following folders: esa/f: 751 KB esa/g: 842 KB merge satellite bands corresponding geographical area (tiles) classify according spatial resolution, create object satres class. pass parameter folder files located. Next consult spatial resolution result (remember changed resolution, adding factor 100). obtain object class SpatRaster terra package bands indicated spatial resolution. show available bands, represent graphically .  bands directly accessible name (B02, B03, B04 B08 figure), within object obtained result.
code: esa <- system.file("extdata", "esa", package = "satres") sr <- satres(dir = esa) sr |>   get_spatial_resolution() #> [1] "r1000m" "r2000m" "r6000m" b <- sr |>   as_SpatRaster("r1000m") terra::plot(b)
